trans-unit.source: Represents the collection of items in a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox"></xref>.
The collection is accessed from the parent control, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox>, by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.Items%2A> property.

To create a collection of objects to display in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox> control, you can add or remove the items individually by using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.ObjectCollection.Add%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListBox.ObjectCollection.Remove%2A> methods.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.ObjectCollection"></xref> class.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox"></xref> that owns the collection.
Adds an item to the list of items for a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox"></xref>, specifying the object to add and whether it is checked.
This method adds an item to the list.
For a list, the item is added to the end of the existing list of items.
For a sorted checked list box, the item is inserted into the list according to its sorted position.
A `SystemException` occurs if there is insufficient space available to store the new item.
An object representing the item to add to the collection.
`true` to check the item; otherwise, `false`.
The index of the newly added item.
Adds an item to the list of items for a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox"></xref>, specifying the object to add and the initial checked value.
This method adds an item to the checked list box.
For an unsorted checked list box, the item is added to the end of the existing list of items.
For a sorted checked list box, the item is inserted into the list according to its sorted position.
A `SystemException` occurs if there is insufficient space available to store the new item.
An object representing the item to add to the collection.
The initial <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CheckState"></xref> for the checked portion of the item.
The index of the newly added item.
The check parameter is not one of the valid values.
